text: Pentti Koskela (born 27 November 1945) is a Finnish former ice hockey goaltender and Olympian. Koskela played with Team Finland at the 1968 Winter Olympics held in Grenoble, France. He previously played for Ilves Tampere in SM-Liiga.Society for International Hockey Research Database, retrieved June 29, 2015 ==References== Category:1945 births Category:Living people Category:Ice hockey players at the 1968 Winter Olympics Category:Olympic ice hockey players of Finland Category:Finnish ice hockey goaltenders
title: Pentti Koskela
